materials.raw_text:
Lithium carbonate (Li2CO3) - 6.0 g 
 Nickel (II) oxide (NiO) - 24.0 g 
 Phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5) - 12.0 g 
 Yttrium oxide (Y2O3) - 5.0 g 
 Deionized water - 50.0 g (for slurry)

sourcing.instructions: Lithium carbonate can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online suppliers. Nickel (II) oxide is available from material science suppliers. Phosphorus pentoxide can be purchased from chemical distributors. Yttrium oxide is typically available from rare earth suppliers. Deionized water can be obtained from laboratory supply stores or made using a water purification system.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 6.0 g of lithium carbonate, 24.0 g of nickel (II) oxide, 12.0 g of phosphorus pentoxide, and 5.0 g of yttrium oxide using an analytical balance. 
 2. In a clean container, combine the dry ingredients thoroughly to create a uniform powder mixture. 
 3. Gradually add 50.0 g of deionized water to the powder mixture while stirring continuously to form a homogenous slurry.

cooling.raw_text:
